Key Match Events: The Dodgers clinched a 7-5 win in their first game against the San Diego Padres on Saturday.
On Sunday, the Dodgers suffered a lopsided 10-2 defeat, tying the National League Division Series at one game apiece.
Shohei Ohtani delivered a three-run home run to help power Saturday’s come-from-behind victory.
Padres left fielder Jurickson Profar reached over the left-field fence to snag what would have been a home-run hit by Mookie Betts.
Fernando Tatis Jr. blew kisses to the stands and seemed to strut after making a wild catch in the fourth inning.
The game experienced a roughly 10-minute delay due to fans throwing baseballs, beer cans, and water bottles into the outfield.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans threw balls and water bottles at players and possibly took a few swings at one another at Dodger Stadium.
At least two fans were ejected from Saturday’s game after they made their way onto left field.
Several videos circulated on X showed fans wearing Dodger jerseys exchanging punches in the concourse, in the stands, and in the parking lot.
A Dodgers spokesman said the clips showing brawls among fans were not taken Sunday but were old videos.
Heading into the seventh inning, fans threw two baseballs into the outfield, leading to a security response.
